intro: Chelyella tubercularis, commonly known as the tuberculate chelyella, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tuberculate (bumpy) leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
